title: hellenic-styled font on starbucks packaging
content:
I would like to identify this hellenic-styled font, used on packaging of Starbucks.

Really sorry for the low quality of images...

Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419093334im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0292_6223.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419093334im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0293_3537.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [IMG\_0293.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419093334/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0293.png) | 154.38 KB |
| [IMG\_0292.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419093334/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0292.png) | 167.83 KB |
author: arotron 473

comments.content:
I don't have a specific match in mind, but Storm Type has a number of serif faces with expressive, idiosyncratic details.

[http://www.stormtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419093334/http:/www.stormtype.com/ "http://www.stormtype.com")

Thanks for replying.

Clichee is quite near, but not...

Any other recommendation?

Thanks for replying.

Clichee is quite near, but not...

Any other recommendation?

Could you take better pictures of these?

I have seen the top one before...

The swelling ascenders and descenders reminds me of this font:  
 [http://www.typefacedesign.org/resources/A5specimen/2007/JenniAhonen\_Ilon...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419093334/http:/www.typefacedesign.org/resources/A5specimen/2007/JenniAhonen_Ilona_specimen.pdf "http://www.typefacedesign.org/resources/A5specimen/2007/JenniAhonen\_Ilona\_specimen.pdf")

This type seems to have italic features in a vertical form, and the stems are quite odd. The font Mikey picked above is similar, and the best I could come up with is also only similar. It's Victor de Castro's [Hudson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419093334/http:/www.unifonts.com/h_pages/hudsonbold.htm).

- Mike Yanega
the “t” in Delight looks like an ugly Gill Sans t.
